main_definition: A knight is a person granted an honorary title of knighthood by a monarch or other political leader, typically in recognition of service to the country, especially military valor.

meanings_and_examples.example: In medieval times, knights were heavily armored soldiers who served their lords and fought on horseback.
Sir Arthur Pendragon was appointed Knight Commander for his bravery in battle during the Crusades.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who adheres to a code of chivalry
meanings_and_examples.example: The knight pledged to protect the weak and uphold justice, following the principles of honor and integrity.
In various books and movies, knights are depicted as noble characters who embark on quests to save kingdoms from evil forces.
